citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The facility had a moderate accumulation of stacked transport and primary enclosures stored outdoors on the grounds,
directly across from the enclosures housing an Eastern Screech owl and Great Horned owl. The facility representative
stated this storage area was previously scheduled to be downsized and sorted through, but unforeseen circumstances in
staffing resulted in the storage space remaining cluttered and unaddressed at this time.
Excess collection and storage of idle items can attract pests, vermin and other undesired wildlife that often harbor
diseases. In addition, husbandry standards are difficult to maintain. The premise must be kept clean and in good repair to
protect the birds from injury and disease, and to facilitate good husbandry practices required in this subpart, to reduce or
eliminate breeding and living areas for rodents, pests, and vermin.
Correct by May 3, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.158(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The facility had a moderate accumulation of stacked transport and primary enclosures stored outdoors on the grounds, 
directly across from the enclosures housing an Eastern Screech owl and Great Horned owl. The facility representative 
stated this storage area was previously scheduled to be downsized and sorted through, but unforeseen circumstances in 
staffing resulted in the storage space remaining cluttered and unaddressed at this time.  
 
Excess collection and storage of idle items can attract pests, vermin and other undesired wildlife that often harbor 
diseases. In addition, husbandry standards are difficult to maintain. The premise must be kept clean and in good repair to 
protect the birds from injury and disease, and to facilitate good husbandry practices required in this subpart, to reduce or 
eliminate breeding and living areas for rodents, pests, and vermin. 
 
Correct by May 3, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
